anthropic_key_uuid.description: Optional anthropic key uuid for use with anthropic models

instruction.description: Agent instruction. Instructions help your agent to perform its job effectively. See [Write Effective Agent Instructions](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/genai-platform/concepts/best-practices/#agent-instructions) for best practices.
instruction.example: "You are an agent who thinks deeply about the world"

k.description: How many results should be considered from an attached knowledge base

max_tokens.description: Specifies the maximum number of tokens the model can process in a single input or output, set as a number between 1 and 512. This determines the length of each response.

open_ai_key_uuid.description: Optional OpenAI key uuid for use with OpenAI models

project_id.description: The id of the DigitalOcean project this agent will belong to

retrieval_method.description:
- RETRIEVAL_METHOD_UNKNOWN: The retrieval method is unknown
 - RETRIEVAL_METHOD_REWRITE: The retrieval method is rewrite
 - RETRIEVAL_METHOD_STEP_BACK: The retrieval method is step back
 - RETRIEVAL_METHOD_SUB_QUERIES: The retrieval method is sub queries
 - RETRIEVAL_METHOD_NONE: The retrieval method is none

tags.description: A set of abitrary tags to organize your agent

temperature.description: Controls the modelâ€™s creativity, specified as a number between 0 and 1. Lower values produce more predictable and conservative responses, while higher values encourage creativity and variation.

top_p.description: Defines the cumulative probability threshold for word selection, specified as a number between 0 and 1. Higher values allow for more diverse outputs, while lower values ensure focused and coherent responses.
